section.title: Polynomials Orthogonal on the Unit Circle

para.sentence: A system of polynomials \{\phi_{n}(z)\} , n=0,1,\dots , where \phi_{n}(z) is of proper degree n , is orthonormal on the unit circle with respect to the weight function w(z) ( \geq 0 ) if \frac{1}{2\pi\mathrm{i}}\int_{|z|=1}\phi_{n}(z)\overline{\phi_{m}(z)}w(z)\frac {\mathrm{d}z}{z}=\delta_{n,m}, where the bar signifies complex conjugate.
See Simon (2005a, b) for general theory.
Denote \phi_{n}(z)=\kappa_{n}z^{n}+\sum_{\ell=1}^{n}\kappa_{n,n-\ell}z^{n-\ell}, where \kappa_{n}(>0) , and \kappa_{n,n-\ell}(\in\mathbb{C}) are constants.
Also denote \phi_{n}^{*}(z)=z^{n}\overline{\phi_{n}({\overline{z}^{-1}})}={\kappa_{n}}+ \sum_{\ell=1}^{n}\overline{\kappa}_{n,n-\ell}z^{\ell}, where the bar again signifies compex conjugate.

Then \kappa_{n}z\phi_{n}(z)=\kappa_{n+1}\phi_{n+1}(z)-\phi_{n+1}(0)\phi_{n+1}^{*}(z), , \kappa_{n}\phi_{n+1}(z)=\kappa_{n+1}z\phi_{n}(z)+\phi_{n+1}(0)\phi_{n}^{*}(z), , \kappa_{n}\phi_{n}(0)\phi_{n+1}(z)+\kappa_{n-1}\phi_{n+1}(0)z\phi_{n-1}(z)= \left(\kappa_{n}\phi_{n+1}(0)+\kappa_{n+1}\phi_{n}(0)z\right)\phi_{n}(z).

subsection.title: Connection with OP’s on the Line

para.sentence: Assume that w(e^{\mathrm{i}\phi})=w(e^{-\mathrm{i}\phi}).
Let \{p_{n}(x)\} and \{q_{n}(x)\} , n=0,1,\dots , be OP’s with weight functions w_{1}(x) and w_{2}(x) , respectively, on (-1,1).

Then p_{n}\left(\tfrac{1}{2}(z+z^{-1})\right)=\text{(const.)}\times{\left(z^{-n} \phi_{2n}(z)+z^{n}\phi_{2n}(z^{-1})\right)}=\text{(const.)}\times{\left(z^{-n+ 1}\phi_{2n-1}(z)+z^{n-1}\phi_{2n-1}(z^{-1})\right)}, , q_{n}\left(\tfrac{1}{2}(z+z^{-1})\right)={\text{(const.)}\times\frac{z^{-n-1} \phi_{2n+2}(z)-z^{n+1}\phi_{2n+2}(z^{-1})}{z-z^{-1}}}={\text{(const.)}\times \frac{z^{-n}\phi_{2n+1}(z)-z^{n}\phi_{2n+1}(z^{-1})}{z-z^{-1}}}.

Conversely, z^{-n}\phi_{2n}(z)={A_{n}p_{n}\left(\tfrac{1}{2}(z+z^{-1})\right)+B_{n}(z-z^{- 1})q_{n-1}\left(\tfrac{1}{2}(z+z^{-1})\right)}, , z^{-n+1}\phi_{2n-1}(z)={C_{n}p_{n}\left(\tfrac{1}{2}(z+z^{-1})\right)+D_{n}(z- z^{-1})q_{n-1}\left(\tfrac{1}{2}(z+z^{-1})\right)}, where A_{n} , B_{n} , C_{n} , and D_{n} are independent of z.

\phi_{n}(z)=\sum_{\ell=0}^{n}\frac{{\left(\lambda+1\right)_{\ell}}{\left( \lambda\right)_{n-\ell}}}{\ell!\,(n-\ell)!}\,z^{\ell}=\frac{{\left(\lambda \right)_{n}}}{n!}{{}_{2}F_{1}}\left({-n,\lambda+1\atop-\lambda-n+1};z\right) , with w(z)=\left(1-\tfrac{1}{2}(z+z^{-1})\right)^{\lambda},w_{1}(x)=(1-x)^{\lambda-\frac{1}{2}}(1+x)^{-\frac{1}{2}},w_{2}(x)=(1-x)^{\lambda+\frac{1}{2}}(1+x)^{\frac{1}{2}}, if \lambda>-\tfrac{1}{2}.
For the hypergeometric function {{}_{2}F_{1}} see §§15.1 and 15.2(i).

\phi_{n}(z)=\sum_{\ell=0}^{n}\frac{\left(aq^{2};q^{2}\right)_{\ell}\left(a;q^{ 2}\right)_{n-\ell}}{\left(q^{2};q^{2}\right)_{\ell}\left(q^{2};q^{2}\right)_{n -\ell}}(q^{-1}z)^{\ell}=\frac{\left(a;q^{2}\right)_{n}}{\left(q^{2};q^{2} \right)_{n}}{{}_{2}\phi_{1}}\left({aq^{2},q^{-2n}\atop a^{-1}q^{2-2n}};q^{2}, \frac{qz}{a}\right), with w(z)={\left|\left(qz;q^{2}\right)_{\infty}\Bigm{/}\left(aqz;q^{2}\right)_{ \infty}\right|^{2}}, if a^{2}q^{2}<1.
For the notation, including the basic hypergeometric function {{}_{2}\phi_{1}} , see §§17.2 and 17.4(i).
When a=0 the Askey case is also known as the Rogers–Szegő case.

subsection.title: Biorthogonal Polynomials on the Unit Circle

para.sentence: See Baxter (1961) for general theory.
